results.title: The Class
results.creator_credit: John Schlesinger, Huw Wheldon and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Monitor”.
A close-up of the work of a class in a drama school and of the methods used to train the aspiring actors and actresses. John Schlesinger’s command of the particular directing technique required is such that the film appears to have been made spontaneously during the forty minutes or so of the single class. In fact it needed a week’s shooting and a considerable amount of preparation in order to give this impression. The tutor (Harold Lang) uses the Mercy Speech from ‘The Merchant of Venice’ as a starting point in an improvisation by the students. Originally made for the BBC Television program ‘Monitor’, it is exciting to watch a production in the hands of a dedicated artist.

group_works.title: Talking metric
group_works.creator_credit: Peter Riding, Michael Garrod and British Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: Talking metric
results.creator_credit: Peter Riding, Michael Garrod and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Know How Series”
Discusses the change to the metric system in industry, its advantage and opportunities for rationalisation procedure in changeover, training and other aspects.

results.title: BBC 24 Hours
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

group_works.title: Are we doing enough about retirement?

results.title: Are we doing enough about retirement?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC 24 Hours”.
To many people retirement comes as a shock and leaves a vacuum in their lives which is all too often filled with worries about their health. An association in Birmingham which tries to help people enjoy their retired years, and a workshop where people work half time shifts in an attempt to improve the situation. No other credits available.

results.title: B.P. Road Safety
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Take the bus
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “B.P. Road Safety”
Drinking and driving are a bad combination. Shows examples of things that can happen when the driver has had a “few” at the local hotel. Stresses that it is better to “take the bus” after drinking and so avoid accidents which can happen to the driver, his car and anything that gets in his way.

results.title: Not all pedestrians are people
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “B.P. Road Safety”.
Stresses that not all pedestrians are people! The driver should always give way to pedestrians and that includes people who are careless, children, animals and even the occasional duck! The good driver anticipates what pedestrians and animals may do, especially at night. Advises the rules which both drivers and pedestrians should follow in order to drive safely and avoid accidents.

results.title: Know your car
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “B.P. Road Safety”.
A car is a coach of steel weighing a ton or more, with about a 200 plus horse power engine. The driver should know what this weight and power can do, especially before breaking any of the road rules. Don’t take your car for granted - make sure that brakes are in good condition, that all tyres are in good order, that wheels alignment is right and that all you car lights are working - know your car and stay alive.

results.title: Flying blind
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “B.P. Road Safety”.
The “flying blind” driver is the person who is inattentive and does not seem to be aware that three seconds of “flying blind” can cause accidents. Shows examples of inattentive driving and emphasises that fatigue can cause tragedy. Recommends that a rest stop every two hours or every 100 miles for highway driving is a safety precaution which should not be ignored.
